meanings.definition: A small shelter for a dog.
meanings.sent1: My neighbor built cozy doghouses for his three furry friends.
meanings.sent2: The doghouses in the park provide shade for the pets on hot days.
meanings.sent3: The doghouses were so colorful that they looked like tiny cottages.
meanings.sent4: The row of doghouses resembled a miniature village under the trees.
meanings.sent5: The doghouses were painted in bright colors to make them easy to spot.

meanings.definition: To put someone in a situation where they are criticized or punished.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally doghoused myself by forgetting my friend's birthday.
meanings.sent2: The teacher warned the students not to doghouse each other during the group project.
meanings.sent3: He didn't mean to doghouse his brother by revealing the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: Her careless mistake doghoused her in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent5: The boss decided to doghouse the employee for arriving late to work.
